intro: Selago muddii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a strong fragrance to attract pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Selago muddii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils in full sun.
